availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William S. Ross (Union + Hopkins County farmer )

body.p: Union County and Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer. Maryland native. Married to Ellen D. Ross. Father of Mariam Ross, J. B. Ross, William S. Ross, M. A. Ross, William B. Ross, and Henrietta M. Ross. Farmer in Union County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Madisonville in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in Madisonville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, District 2, p. 484B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Madisonville, p. 833-34.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Madisonville, p. 221A.
"William Stuart Ross (1799-1861)," Find A Grave, Memorial #66833821, accessed August 5, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/66833821.
